intro: Pilocereus strausii f. cristatus, commonly known as the cristate night blooming cactus, is a unique variant of the Pilocereus strausii species. It is characterized by its distinctive crest-like growth pattern, which gives it a whimsical, almost otherworldly appearance. The plant is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces fragrant, white flowers that open at night, adding to its allure. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in cactus gardens and greenhouses.
